page.title: 02PLACES OF WORSHIP
page.content: {On Sunday}I go to the Meeting House three times. We are Christians, called the Brethren. On Sunday morning we have bread and wine. In the afternoon it's Sunday School where we sing and pray. The adults go into another room for their class. In the evening we pray and a man talks to us. A Hindu religious building is called a Mandir. When we go in we take off our shoes and sit down on the floor and are quiet because people read Hindu holy books like the Geeta. The Mandir is decorated by big pictures of the many gods we worship and tinselled bells. Everyone stands up, sings two songs and we say our prayers. Before everyone leaves we eat parshad, made of semolina, ghee and sugar. At the Pentecostal Church we sing hymns,pray and have readings from the Bible by the preacher or pastor.
